00038 /*

00045 #define V1718_MINOR_BASE   178
00046 
00047 /* stall/wait timeout for V1718 */
00048 #define NAK_TIMEOUT (HZ)
00049 
00050 #define IBUF_SIZE 0x10000       /* 64 kbytes */
00051 
00052 /* Size of the V1718 buffer */
00053 #define OBUF_SIZE 0x10000       /* 64 kbytes */
00054 
00055 /* we can have up to this number of devices plugged in at once */
00056 #define MAX_DEVICES     16
00057 //
00058 // Rev 0.2: added ini
00059 #include <linux/version.h>
00060 
00061 #ifndef VERSION
00062         #define VERSION(ver,rel,seq) (((ver)<<16) | ((rel)<<8) | (seq))
00063 #endif  
00064 
00065 #if LINUX_VERSION_CODE >= VERSION(2,5,0)
00066         #define USB_ST_NOERROR 0
00067         #define USB_ST_CRC (-EILSEQ)
00068         #define USB_ST_BITSTUFF (-EPROTO)
00069         #define USB_ST_DATAOVERRUN (-EOVERFLOW)
00070         #define USB_ST_DATAUNDERRUN             (-EREMOTEIO)
00071         #define USB_ST_BUFFEROVERRUN (-ECOMM)
00072         #define USB_ST_BUFFERUNDERRUN (-ENOSR)
00073         #define USB_ST_INTERNALERROR (-EPROTO) /* unknown error */
00074         #define USB_ST_SHORT_PACKET (-EREMOTEIO)
00075         #define USB_ST_PARTIAL_ERROR (-EXDEV) /* ISO transfer only parti ally completed */
00076         #define USB_ST_URB_KILLED (-ENOENT) /* URB canceled by user */
00077         #define USB_ST_URB_PENDING (-EINPROGRESS)
00078         #define USB_ST_REMOVED (-ENODEV) /* device not existing or removed */
00079         #define USB_ST_TIMEOUT (-ETIMEDOUT) /* communication timed out, also in urb->status**/
00080         #define USB_ST_NOTSUPPORTED (-ENOSYS)
00081         #define USB_ST_BANDWIDTH_ERROR (-ENOSPC) /* too much bandwidth used */
00082         #define USB_ST_URB_INVALID_ERROR (-EINVAL) /* invalid value/transfer type */
00083         #define USB_ST_URB_REQUEST_ERROR (-ENXIO) /* invalid endpoint */
00084         #define USB_ST_STALL (-EPIPE) /* pipe stalled, also in urb->status*/
00085 #else
00086     #error ######################################################
00087     #error ######################################################
00088     #error THIS DRIVER NOT IS COMPATIBLE WITH YOUR KERNEL VERSION
00089     #error ######################################################
00090     #error ######################################################
00091 #endif

00106 struct v1718_usb_data {
00107     struct usb_device *v1718_dev;   /* init: probe_v1718 */     
00108     unsigned int ifnum;             /* Interface number of the USB device */
00109     int open_count;                 /* number of users */
00110     int present;                    /* Device is present on the bus */
00111     int minor;                      /* minor number for the device */
00112     char *obuf, *ibuf;              /* transfer buffers */
00113     char bulk_in_ep, bulk_out_ep;   /* Endpoint assignments */
00114     wait_queue_head_t wait_q;       /* for timeouts */
00115     struct semaphore lock;          /* general race avoidance */
00116 // Rev 0.4
00117 #if LINUX_VERSION_CODE >= VERSION(2,6,11)
00118     struct mutex           ioctl_lock;
00119 #endif
00120 };
00121 
00122 /* array of pointers to our devices that are currently connected */
00123 static struct v1718_usb_data *minor_table[MAX_DEVICES];
00124 
00125 /* lock to protect the minor_table structure */
00126 #if LINUX_VERSION_CODE <= VERSION(2,6,35)
00127 static DECLARE_MUTEX (minor_table_mutex);
00128 #else
00129 static DEFINE_SEMAPHORE (minor_table_mutex);
00130 #endif
00131 
00132 static void v1718_delete(struct v1718_usb_data *v1718)
00133 {
00134 #ifndef CONFIG_USB_DYNAMIC_MINORS
00135         minor_table[v1718->minor] = NULL;
00136 #else
00137         int i = 0;
00138         for (; i < MAX_DEVICES; i++) if (v1718->minor == minor_table[i]->minor) break;
00139         if (i < MAX_DEVICES) minor_table[i] = NULL;
00140 #endif
00141         if( v1718->ibuf != NULL )
00142                 kfree(v1718->ibuf);
00143         if( v1718->obuf != NULL )
00144                 kfree(v1718->obuf);
00145         kfree(v1718);
00146 }

00149 #if LINUX_VERSION_CODE >= VERSION(2,6,11)
00150 static long unlocked_ioctl_v1718(struct file *, unsigned int, unsigned long);
00151 #endif
00152 
00153 static int open_v1718(struct inode *inode, struct file *file)
00154 {
00155         struct v1718_usb_data *v1718 = NULL;
00156         int subminor;
00157 
00158 #ifndef CONFIG_USB_DYNAMIC_MINORS
00159         subminor = MINOR(inode->i_rdev) - V1718_MINOR_BASE;
00160 #else
00161         for (subminor=0;  subminor<MAX_DEVICES; subminor++) if (MINOR(inode->i_rdev) == minor_table[subminor]->minor) break;
00162 #endif
00163 
00164         if( (subminor < 0) || (subminor > MAX_DEVICES) )
00165                 return -ENODEV;
00166 
00167         down(&minor_table_mutex);
00168 
00169         v1718 = minor_table[subminor];
00170         if( v1718 == NULL ) {
00171                 up(&minor_table_mutex);
00172                 return -ENODEV;
00173         }
00174 
00175         down(&v1718->lock);
00176 
00177         up(&minor_table_mutex);
00178 
00179         v1718->open_count++;
00180 
00181         init_waitqueue_head(&v1718->wait_q);
00182 
00183 
00184 #if LINUX_VERSION_CODE >= VERSION(2,6,11)
00185         mutex_init(&v1718->ioctl_lock);
00186 #endif
00187         file->private_data = v1718;
00188         up(&v1718->lock);
00189 
00190         return 0;
00191 }
00192 
00193 static int close_v1718(struct inode *inode, struct file *file)
00194 {
00195         struct v1718_usb_data *v1718 = (struct v1718_usb_data *)file->private_data;
00196         int retval = 0;
00197         if( v1718 == NULL ) {
00198                 printk("Close: object is null\n");
00199                 return -ENODEV;
00200         }
00201         down(&minor_table_mutex);
00202         down(&v1718->lock);
00203 
00204         if( v1718->open_count <= 0 ) {
00205                 printk("Device not opened\n");
00206                 retval = -ENODEV;
00207                 goto exit_not_opened;
00208         }
00209 
00210         if( v1718->v1718_dev == NULL ) {
00211                 /* the device was unplugged before the file was released */
00212                 up(&v1718->lock);
00213                 v1718_delete(v1718);
00214                 up(&minor_table_mutex);
00215                 return 0;
00216         }
00217 
00218         v1718->open_count--;
00219 
00220 exit_not_opened:
00221         up(&(v1718->lock));
00222         up(&minor_table_mutex);
00223 
00224         return retval;
00225 }
00226 
00227 static int
00228 ioctl_v1718(struct inode *inode, struct file *file, unsigned int cmd,
00229             unsigned long arg)
00230 {
00231 
00232 
00233         int ret= 0;
00234         struct v1718_usb_data *v1718;
00235         
00236         v1718 = (struct v1718_usb_data *)file->private_data;
00237         down(&(v1718->lock));
00238     /* Sanity check to make sure v1718 is connected, powered, etc */
00239     if ( v1718 == NULL ||
00240          v1718->present == 0 ||
00241          v1718->v1718_dev == NULL )
00242         {
00243                 up(&(v1718->lock));
00244                 return -ENOTTY;
00245         }
00246 
00247     switch (cmd) {
00248         case V1718_IOCTL_REV:
00249                         {
00250                                 v1718_rev_t rev;
00251                 if( copy_from_user(&rev, (v1718_rev_t *)arg, sizeof(rev)) > 0 ) {
00252                         ret = -EFAULT;
00253                         break;
00254                 }
00255                                 strcpy( rev.rev_buf, DRIVER_VERSION);
00256                 if( copy_to_user((v1718_rev_t *)arg, &rev, sizeof(rev)) > 0) {
00257                         ret = -EFAULT;
00258                         break;
00259                 }
00260                         }
00261                 break;
00262                 case V1718_IOCTL_REBOOTB:
00263                         ret =   usb_control_msg(v1718->v1718_dev, usb_sndctrlpipe(v1718->v1718_dev,0),0xB0, 0x20,1, 0, NULL, 0, 1 * HZ);
00264                         ret |=  usb_control_msg(v1718->v1718_dev, usb_sndctrlpipe(v1718->v1718_dev,0),0xB0, 0x20,0, 0, NULL, 0, 1 * HZ);
00265                 break;
00266                 case V1718_IOCTL_REBOOTF:
00267                         ret =   usb_control_msg(v1718->v1718_dev, usb_sndctrlpipe(v1718->v1718_dev,0),0xB0, 0x20,3, 0, NULL, 0, 1 * HZ);
00268                         ret |=  usb_control_msg(v1718->v1718_dev, usb_sndctrlpipe(v1718->v1718_dev,0),0xB0, 0x20,2, 0, NULL, 0, 1 * HZ);
00269                 break;
00270                 default:
00271                         ret= -ENOTTY;
00272                         break;
00273     }
00274         up(&(v1718->lock));
00275     return ret;
00276 }
00277 
00278 
00279 /*
00280         ----------------------------------------------------------------------
00281 
00282         unlocked_ioctl_v1718 (Called in preference to ioctl_v1718 on newer kernels)
00283 
00284         ----------------------------------------------------------------------
00285 */
00286 
00287 #if LINUX_VERSION_CODE >= VERSION(2,6,11)
00288 static long unlocked_ioctl_v1718(struct file *file, unsigned int cmd, unsigned long arg)
00289 {
00290         struct inode *inode = file->f_dentry->d_inode;
00291         struct v1718_usb_data *s = (struct v1718_usb_data *)file->private_data;
00292         long ret;
00293 
00294         /* ioctl() calls can cause the Big Kernel Lock (BKL) to be taken, which
00295          * can have significant performance penalties system-wide.  By providing
00296          * an unlocked ioctl() method the BKL will not be taken, but the driver
00297          * becomes responsible for its own locking.  Furthermore, the lock can be
00298          * broken down per A2818 so that multiple threads accessing different CONET
00299          * chains do not contend with one another during ioctl() calls.
00300          */
00301         mutex_lock(&s->ioctl_lock);
00302         ret = (long) ioctl_v1718(inode, file, cmd, arg);
00303         mutex_unlock(&s->ioctl_lock);
00304 
00305         return ret;
00306 }
00307 #endif
00308 
00309 static ssize_t
00310 write_v1718(struct file *file, const char *buffer,
00311             size_t count, loff_t * ppos)
00312 {
00313         struct v1718_usb_data *v1718;
00314 
00315         unsigned long copy_size;
00316         unsigned long bytes_written = 0;
00317         unsigned int partial;
00318 
00319         int result = 0;
00320         int maxretry;
00321         int errn = 0;
00322 
00323         v1718 = (struct v1718_usb_data *)file->private_data;
00324 
00325         down(&(v1718->lock));
00326         /* Sanity check to make sure v1718 is connected, powered, etc */
00327         if ( v1718 == NULL ||
00328              v1718->present == 0 ||
00329              v1718->v1718_dev == NULL )
00330         {
00331                 up(&(v1718->lock));
00332                 return -ENODEV;
00333         }
00334 
00335         do {
00336                 unsigned long thistime;
00337                 char *obuf = v1718->obuf;
00338 
00339                 thistime = copy_size =
00340                     (count >= OBUF_SIZE) ? OBUF_SIZE : count;
00341                 if (copy_from_user(v1718->obuf, buffer, copy_size)) {
00342                         errn = -EFAULT;
00343                         goto error;
00344                 }
00345                 maxretry = 1;   
00346                 while (thistime) {
00347                         if (!v1718->v1718_dev) {
00348                                 errn = -ENODEV;
00349                                 goto error;
00350                         }
00351                         if (signal_pending(current)) {
00352                                 up(&(v1718->lock));
00353                                 return bytes_written ? bytes_written : -EINTR;
00354                         }
00355 
00356                         result = usb_bulk_msg(v1718->v1718_dev,
00357                                          usb_sndbulkpipe(v1718->v1718_dev, 2),
00358                                          obuf, thistime, &partial, 1 * HZ);     // TEMP - 1 sec basta?
00359 
00360                         dbg("write stats: result:%d thistime:%lu partial:%u",
00361                              result, thistime, partial);
00362 
00363                         if (result == USB_ST_TIMEOUT) { 
00364                                 if (!maxretry--) {
00365                                         errn = -ETIME;
00366                                         goto error;
00367                                 }
00368 
00369                                 wait_event_interruptible_timeout(v1718-> wait_q,(result == USB_ST_TIMEOUT),NAK_TIMEOUT);
00370                                 continue;
00371                         } else if (!result && partial) {
00372                                 obuf += partial;
00373                                 thistime -= partial;
00374                         } else
00375                                 break;
00376                 };
00377                 if (result) {
00378                         printk("Write Whoops - %x\n", result);
00379                         errn = -EIO;
00380                         goto error;
00381                 }
00382                 bytes_written += copy_size;
00383                 count -= copy_size;
00384                 buffer += copy_size;
00385         } while (count > 0);
00386 
00387         up(&(v1718->lock));
00388 
00389         return bytes_written ? bytes_written : -EIO;
00390 
00391 error:
00392         up(&(v1718->lock));
00393         return errn;
00394 }
00395 
00396 static ssize_t
00397 read_v1718(struct file *file, char *buffer, size_t count, loff_t * ppos)
00398 {
00399         struct v1718_usb_data *v1718;
00400         ssize_t read_count;
00401         unsigned int partial;
00402         int this_read;
00403         int result;
00404         int maxretry = 1;       
00405         char *ibuf;
00406 
00407         v1718 = (struct v1718_usb_data *)file->private_data;
00408 
00409         down(&(v1718->lock));
00410         /* Sanity check to make sure v1718 is connected, powered, etc */
00411         if ( v1718 == NULL ||
00412              v1718->present == 0 ||
00413              v1718->v1718_dev == NULL )
00414         {
00415                 up(&(v1718->lock));
00416                 return -ENODEV;
00417         }
00418 
00419         ibuf = v1718->ibuf;
00420 
00421         read_count = 0;
00422 
00423         while (count > 0) {
00424 
00425                 if (!v1718->v1718_dev) {
00426                         up(&(v1718->lock));
00427                         return -ENODEV;
00428                 }
00429                 this_read = (count >= IBUF_SIZE) ? IBUF_SIZE : count;
00430 
00431                 result = usb_bulk_msg(v1718->v1718_dev,
00432                                       usb_rcvbulkpipe(v1718->v1718_dev, 6),
00433                                       ibuf, this_read, &partial,
00434                                       (int) (HZ * 1)); 
00435 
00436                 dbg("read stats: result:%d this_read:%u partial:%u",
00437                        result, this_read, partial);
00438                 if (partial) {
00439                         count = this_read = partial;
00440                 } else {
00441                         switch( result){
00442                         case USB_ST_BUFFERUNDERRUN:
00443                                 printk( "DBG read_v1718 USB_ST_BUFFERUNDERRUN ...\n" );
00444                                 usb_clear_halt( v1718->v1718_dev, 6);
00445                                 up(&(v1718->lock));
00446                                 return (0);
00447                         case USB_ST_TIMEOUT:
00448                         case 15: 
00449                                 if (!maxretry--) {
00450                                         up(&(v1718->lock));
00451                                         printk("read: maxretry timeout\n");
00452                                         return -ETIME;
00453                                 }
00454 
00455                                 wait_event_interruptible_timeout(v1718-> wait_q,1,NAK_TIMEOUT);
00456                                 this_read= 0;
00457                                 break;
00458                         case USB_ST_DATAOVERRUN:
00459                                 {
00460                                         int count_retry= 100;
00461                                         do {
00462                                                 printk( "DATAOVERRUN\n");
00463                                                 usb_clear_halt( v1718->v1718_dev, 6);
00464                                                 if( usb_bulk_msg(v1718->v1718_dev,
00465                                                       usb_rcvbulkpipe(v1718->v1718_dev, 6),
00466                                                       ibuf, IBUF_SIZE, &partial,
00467                                                       (int) (HZ * 1))!= USB_ST_DATAOVERRUN){
00468                                                         break;
00469                                                 }
00470                                         } while( count_retry--);
00471                                 }
00472                                 up(&(v1718->lock));
00473                                 return -EIO;
00474                         case USB_ST_SHORT_PACKET:
00475                         case USB_ST_PARTIAL_ERROR:
00476                         case USB_ST_URB_KILLED:
00477                         case USB_ST_URB_PENDING:
00478                         case USB_ST_REMOVED:
00479                         case USB_ST_CRC:
00480                         case USB_ST_BITSTUFF:
00481                         case USB_ST_BUFFEROVERRUN:
00482                         case USB_ST_NOTSUPPORTED:
00483                         case USB_ST_BANDWIDTH_ERROR:
00484                         case USB_ST_URB_INVALID_ERROR:
00485                         case USB_ST_URB_REQUEST_ERROR:
00486                         case USB_ST_STALL:
00487                         default:
00488                                 usb_clear_halt( v1718->v1718_dev, 6);
00489                                 up(&(v1718->lock));
00490                                 printk("Read Whoops - result:0x%08x partial:%u this_read:%u\n",
00491                                      result, partial, this_read);
00492                                 return -EIO;
00493                         }
00494                 }
00495                 if (this_read) {
00496                         if (copy_to_user(buffer, ibuf, this_read)) {
00497                                 up(&(v1718->lock));
00498                                 return -EFAULT;
00499                         }
00500                         count -= this_read;
00501                         read_count += this_read;
00502                         buffer += this_read;
00503                 }
00504         }
00505         up(&(v1718->lock));
00506         return read_count;
00507 }
00508 
00509 static struct
00510 file_operations usb_v1718_fops = {
00511         owner:          THIS_MODULE,            
00512         read:           read_v1718,
00513         write:          write_v1718,
00514 #if LINUX_VERSION_CODE < VERSION(2,6,38)                
00515         ioctl:          ioctl_v1718,
00516 #endif
00517 // Rev. 0.4
00518 #if LINUX_VERSION_CODE >= VERSION(2,6,11)
00519         unlocked_ioctl: unlocked_ioctl_v1718,
00520 #endif
00521         open:           open_v1718,
00522         release:        close_v1718,
00523 };
00524 
00525 static struct usb_class_driver usb_v1718_class = {
00526   .name = "usb/v1718_%d",
00527   .fops = &usb_v1718_fops ,
00528 #if LINUX_VERSION_CODE <= VERSION(2,6,13)
00529   .mode = S_IFCHR | S_IRUSR | S_IWUSR | S_IRGRP | S_IWGRP ,
00530 #endif
00531   .minor_base = V1718_MINOR_BASE ,
00532 };
00533 
00534 static int probe_v1718(struct usb_interface *intf,
00535                          const struct usb_device_id *id)                                                 
00536 {
00537         struct usb_device *dev = interface_to_usbdev(intf);
00538         int retval= 0;
00539         struct v1718_usb_data *v1718 = NULL;
00540 // Rev 0.2      
00541 //      char name[12];
00542         int minor;
00543         switch(id->idProduct) {
00544                 case 0x0000:
00545                         printk(KERN_INFO "CAEN Desktop Waveform Digitizers Carrier found at address %d\n", dev->devnum);        
00546                         break;
00547                 case 0x0001:
00548                         printk(KERN_INFO "CAEN NIM Waveform Digitizers Carrier found at address %d\n", dev->devnum);
00549                         break;
00550                 case 0x1002:
00551                         printk(KERN_INFO "CAEN V1718 found at address %d\n", dev->devnum);
00552                         break;
00553                 default:
00554                         printk(KERN_INFO "CAEN V1718 found at address %d\n", dev->devnum);
00555                         break;
00556         }
00557         down(&minor_table_mutex);
00558         for( minor = 0; minor < MAX_DEVICES; ++minor ) {
00559                 if( minor_table[minor] == NULL )
00560                         break;
00561         }
00562         if( minor >= MAX_DEVICES ) {
00563                 printk(KERN_INFO "Too many devices\n");
00564                 goto exit;
00565         }
00566 
00567         v1718 = kmalloc(sizeof(struct v1718_usb_data), GFP_KERNEL);
00568         if (v1718 == NULL) {
00569                 printk("Out of memory\n");
00570                 goto exit;
00571         }
00572         memset(v1718, 0x00, sizeof(*v1718));
00573         minor_table[minor] = v1718;
00574 
00575         if( usb_register_dev(intf, &usb_v1718_class))
00576         {
00577         printk("probe: Not able to get a minor for this device.\n");
00578                 goto error;
00579         }
00580 #ifdef CONFIG_USB_DYNAMIC_MINORS
00581         minor = intf->minor;
00582 #endif
00583         v1718->present = 1;
00584         v1718->v1718_dev = dev;
00585         v1718->minor = minor;
00586 
00587         if (!(v1718->obuf = (char *) kmalloc(OBUF_SIZE, GFP_KERNEL))) {
00588                 printk("probe: Not enough memory for the output buffer\n");
00589                 goto error;
00590         }
00591         dbg("probe: obuf address:%p", v1718->obuf);
00592 
00593         if (!(v1718->ibuf = (char *) kmalloc(IBUF_SIZE, GFP_KERNEL))) {
00594                 printk("probe: Not enough memory for the input buffer\n");
00595                 goto error;
00596         }
00597         dbg("probe: ibuf address:%p", v1718->ibuf);
00598 
00599         usb_set_intfdata (intf, v1718);
00600 #if LINUX_VERSION_CODE <= VERSION(2,6,32)
00601         init_MUTEX(&(v1718->lock));
00602 #else
00603         sema_init(&(v1718->lock),1);
00604 #endif
00605         goto exit;
00606 
00607 error:
00608         usb_deregister_dev(intf, &usb_v1718_class);
00609         retval= -ENOMEM;
00610         v1718_delete(v1718);
00611         v1718 = NULL;
00612 
00613 exit:
00614         up(&minor_table_mutex);
00615         return retval;
00616 
00617 }
00618 
00619 static void disconnect_v1718(struct usb_interface *intf)
00620 {
00621         struct v1718_usb_data *v1718 = usb_get_intfdata (intf);
00622 
00623         int minor;
00624 
00625         down(&minor_table_mutex);
00626         down(&(v1718->lock));
00627 
00628         minor = v1718->minor;
00629 
00630         usb_set_intfdata (intf, NULL);
00631         if (v1718) {
00632                 usb_deregister_dev(intf, &usb_v1718_class);
00633                 if (v1718->open_count != 0) {
00634                         /* better let it finish - the release will do whats needed */
00635                         v1718->v1718_dev = NULL;
00636                         up(&(v1718->lock));
00637                 } else {
00638                         up(&(v1718->lock));
00639                         v1718_delete(v1718);
00640                 }
00641         }
00642 
00643 
00644         printk(KERN_INFO "CAEN #%d device disconnected\n", minor);
00645 
00646         up(&minor_table_mutex);
00647 }
00648 
00649 static struct usb_device_id v1718_table [] = {
00650         { USB_DEVICE(0x0547, 0x1002) },                 /* CAEN V1718 */
00651         { USB_DEVICE(0x21e1, 0x0000) },                 
00652         { USB_DEVICE(0x21e1, 0x0001) }, 
00653         { }                                             /* Terminating entry */
00654 };
00655 
00656 MODULE_DEVICE_TABLE (usb, v1718_table);
00657 
00658 // Rev 0.4
00659 static struct usb_driver v1718_driver = {
00660 #if LINUX_VERSION_CODE < VERSION(2,6,15)
00661         owner:          THIS_MODULE,
00662 #endif  
00663         name:           "v1718",
00664         probe:          probe_v1718,
00665         disconnect:     disconnect_v1718,       
00666         id_table:       v1718_table,
00667 };
00668 
00669 static int __init usb_v1718_init(void)
00670 
00671 {
00672         if (usb_register(&v1718_driver) < 0)
00673                 return -1;
00674         printk(DRIVER_DESC " version " DRIVER_VERSION "\n");
00675 
00676         return 0;
00677 }
00678 
00679 static void __exit usb_v1718_cleanup(void)
00680 
00681 {
00682         usb_deregister(&v1718_driver);
00683 }
00684 
00685 module_init(usb_v1718_init);
00686 module_exit(usb_v1718_cleanup);
00687 
00688 MODULE_AUTHOR( DRIVER_AUTHOR );
00689 MODULE_DESCRIPTION( DRIVER_DESC );
00690 MODULE_LICENSE("GPL");
